compounddef.title: Guide: How to Contribute to Proto

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: Thank you for your interest in contributing to Proto! We welcome contributions from everyone, whether you're fixing a bug, improving documentation, or proposing a major new feature. This document outlines the process for contributing to ensure it's as smooth as possible for everyone involved.

sect1.title: Getting Started
sect1.para: Before you start, it's a good idea to familiarize yourself with the project's architecture. The Architecture Deep Dive documents are the best place to start.
Make sure you can build the project locally by following the Quick Start Guide.

sect1.title: The Contribution Workflow
sect1.para: We follow a standard GitHub-based workflow.

listitem.para: Fork the Repository: Start by forking the main Proto repository to your own GitHub account.
Create a New Branch: For each new feature or bugfix, create a descriptive branch in your fork. ```sh
Make Your Changes: Write your code or documentation. Please adhere to the following guidelines.
Write Tests: If you are adding a new feature or fixing a bug, please add a corresponding test case to the test suite to verify its correctness.
Ensure Tests Pass: Run the full test suite locally to ensure your changes haven't introduced any regressions. sh @section autotoc_md925 From the build directory make test
Commit Your Work: Write clear and concise commit messages. A good commit message explains the "what" and the "why" of the change.
Push to Your Fork: Push your branch to your personal fork on GitHub. sh git push origin feature/add-new-widget

Open a Pull Request (PR): Go to the main Proto repository and open a new Pull Request. The PR description should clearly explain the changes you've made. If it resolves an existing issue, be sure to reference it (e.g., Closes #123).
C++: We adhere to the Google C++ Style Guide. Please try to match the style of the existing codebase.
**Python (proto_python):** We follow the PEP 8 style guide.
Documentation: We use Markdown. Please keep line lengths reasonable (around 80-100 characters) to make diffs easier to read.

sect2.title: Proposing Major Changes
sect2.para: If you want to propose a significant architectural change, please open an issue or start a discussion on the GitHub Discussions page first. This allows the community to discuss the proposal before you invest a lot of time in writing code. This is the best way to ensure your contribution will be aligned with the project's direction and ultimately accepted.

sect2.title: Code of Conduct
sect2.para: We are committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive environment. All contributors are expected to abide by our Code of Conduct. (Note: A CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md file would need to be created for a real project).
